SUMMARY: White House officials have barnstormed Wisconsin to make the connection between big changes and their signature laws.

TITLE: The Fed Is Eyeing the Job Market, but It’s Difficult to Read
SUMMARY: Fed officials are watching labor trends as they contemplate when to cut rates. But different measures are telling different stories.

TITLE: North Carolina Triad Tries to Reinvent Its Economy
SUMMARY: North Carolina’s Triad was built on tobacco, textiles and furniture. Now it’s trying to forge a new economy from more highly skilled manufacturing.

TITLE: Fed Holds Rates Steady, Noting Lack of Progress on Inflation
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve left interest rates unchanged for a sixth straight meeting and suggested that rates would stay high for longer.

TITLE: He Won by a Landslide. Why Is He Fighting for His Political Life?
SUMMARY: Ben Houchen, a regional mayor in the north of England, faces a close re-election race, partly thanks to the broader troubles of Britain’s Conservative Party.

TITLE: U.S. Job Market Eases, but Hiring Remains Firm
SUMMARY: Employers added 175,000 jobs in April, a milder pace than in the winter months, though layoffs have remained low and most sectors appear stable.
